javanews.gui
Class SplashScreen

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              javax.swing.JWindow
                  javanews.gui.SplashScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class SplashScreen
extends javax.swing.JWindow

Used to provide information to the user while the main components of the application are initialised.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

Constructor Detail

SplashScreen

public SplashScreen(int maximumValue)
Initialises the class and sets the maximum value of steps taken to initialise the application. Once the application has passed through these stages, and called increaseProgress() accordingly the splash-screen is updated and eventually closed to allow for interaction with the main program.

Parameters:
maximumValue - The total number of stages of initialisation for the program.
Method Detail

increaseProgress

public void increaseProgress()
Increases the value of the progress bar without changing the displayed text. The value of the progress bar is incremented by one. If the new value of the progress bar is greater than the value the splash-screen was initialised with then it is closed.

increaseProgress

public void increaseProgress(java.lang.String newText)
Increases the value of the progress bar and updates the displayed text to that of the supplied argument. The increaseProgress() method is called to update the value and so the same conditions apply.

Parameters:
newText - The new text to be displayed above the progress bar.
See Also:
increaseProgress()
